intro: Everardia guaiquinimae, commonly known as the Guaiquinimae everardia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
